name: Grantt Care Services
shortDescription: Grantt Care Services is a childcare platform dedicated to supporting families in Canada by connecting them with verified caregivers and early childhood professionals. The website highlights the brand's mission, services, and onboarding process for both families and caregivers.
description:
Grantt Care Services is a purpose-driven childcare platform focused on empowering and supporting families across Canada. It offers a streamlined way to discover and connect with trusted, vetted caregivers and early childhood professionals who understand the unique cultural needs of the community.


I led the frontend development of the website, building a clean, modern, and mobile-responsive interface that communicates trust and professionalism. The platform showcases the company’s services, core values, and onboarding steps for both parents and caregivers.


The website was built using React and Tailwind CSS for performance and design consistency. Emphasis was placed on SEO, accessibility, and intuitive navigation to ensure an inclusive and welcoming user experience.

name: HatWizard
shortDescription: HatWizard is a bespoke e-commerce website for a custom-designed hat business, showcasing unique hat collections and allowing customers to browse, customize, and place orders seamlessly. The brand emphasizes craftsmanship, individuality, and style.
description:
HatWizard is an e-commerce website built for a premium custom-designed hat business. The site was crafted to reflect the brand's identity—highlighting individuality, style, and the art of bespoke hat-making.


I was responsible for building a responsive and visually engaging frontend that showcases different hat collections, customization options, and a smooth shopping experience. The site includes features like product filtering, image galleries, and a user-friendly checkout system.


The tech stack includes React and Tailwind CSS for a modern UI, with integrations for inventory management and order handling on the backend. Emphasis was placed on clean design, mobile responsiveness, and fast loading speeds to ensure both elegance and performance.

name: SHUGALAND
shortDescription: Shugaland is an innovative real estate platform designed to transform property search and investment in Nigeria by connecting buyers, sellers, and agents with a seamless digital experience.
description:
Shugaland is a modern real estate platform set to revitalize Nigeria's property market by providing an intuitive, user-friendly space for property listings, investments, and real estate services. The platform aims to bridge the gap between buyers, sellers, and agents while ensuring transparency and efficiency in property transactions.


I contributed to building a responsive and aesthetically appealing frontend, ensuring smooth navigation, advanced search and filtering, and an optimized user experience for both desktop and mobile users. The site was designed to reflect professionalism while making property discovery and engagement effortless.


The tech stack included React and Tailwind CSS for the frontend, with backend integrations for property management, and authentication. The platform was also optimized for SEO and scalability to accommodate future growth and additional features.

name: EduPorch Website
shortDescription: This website showcases the features of EduPorch, a product by AluSoft Technologies LTD, and enables target users to register, manage accounts, and access services seamlessly—eliminating the need for direct interaction with the development team and automating the previously manual onboarding process.
description:
This web application was built to showcase and support EduPorch, a product developed by AluSoft Technologies LTD. It allows users to register, manage their accounts, and access the platform independently—automating what was previously a manual and time-consuming onboarding process.

 
I collaborated with a team of developers, working on the frontend using HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, JavaScript, and jQuery, while the backend was powered by PHP and MySQL. We followed the Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) paradigm to ensure the codebase was clean and scalable.
 
I led most of the backend development, which marked my first hands-on experience as a full-stack developer. Key features I implemented include user authentication, both basic and advanced CRUD operations, role-based content access, and seamless integration with Paystack for payment processing.

name: FirstX
shortDescription: FirstX is a SaaS platform by 10X Ventures that helps businesses acquire their first 'X' customers through smart outreach. It uses intelligent suggestions, message correction, and algorithmic enhancements to prevent spam flagging and bot detection—streamlining manual organic outreach through the Twitter API.
description:
FirstX is a SaaS platform developed by 10X Ventures to help businesses acquire their first 'X' customers. It leverages intelligent suggestions, message optimizations, and advanced algorithms to reduce the risk of messages being flagged as spam or accounts being marked as bots, while simplifying the otherwise manual process of organic outreach. Twitter, via the Twitter API, serves as the primary outreach channel.

 
I collaborated remotely with a U.S.-based team of full-stack developers. At 10X Ventures, we primarily used Blitz.js, a full-stack React and Node.js framework built on top of Next.js and Express.js. Styling was handled with Tailwind CSS and SCSS, and we used PostgreSQL for our database layer.
 
My key contributions included optimizing how the Twitter API was used for outreach and implementing background processing using queues to offload heavy tasks—significantly improving the application's performance and user experience.

name: ChurchPorch
shortDescription: ChurchPorch is a SaaS product by AluSoft Technologies LTD—a comprehensive and user-friendly church management solution for churches of all sizes. It offers a robust suite of tools to automate church operations, improve communication, and generate valuable insights and reports to support effective long-term administration.
description:
ChurchPorch is a SaaS platform developed by AluSoft Technologies LTD. It’s designed for churches of all sizes and offers an intuitive, feature-rich environment to streamline church operations. With tools that enhance communication, automate workflows, and provide detailed analytics and reports, ChurchPorch empowers churches to manage their affairs efficiently and sustainably.

 
I worked with a small, Nigeria-based team of full-stack developers to bring this product to life. We used the Laravel framework for backend development, Bootstrap and vanilla CSS for frontend styling, and MySQL as our database solution.
 
Given the complexity of the project, I played a central role throughout all stages of development. I also contributed significantly to the development of the mobile application, ensuring a seamless user experience across platforms.

name: SYBG
shortDescription: SYBG (Since You've Been Gone) is a no-code SaaS platform from 10X Ventures that allows website owners to deliver personalized product announcements directly on-site, in-app, or via email—without writing a single line of code.
description:
SYBG (Since You've Been Gone) is a SaaS platform developed by 10X Ventures. It enables website owners to deliver tailored product announcements through on-site messages, in-product notifications, or email—completely code-free.


I worked remotely with a U.S.-based team of full-stack developers on this project. We used Blitz.js, a full-stack React and Node.js framework built on Next.js and Express.js. Tailwind CSS and SCSS were used for styling, and PostgreSQL was our database of choice.


This was the second SaaS application I built using the React and Node.js stack, and it marked a noticeable step forward in my technical growth. One of the most challenging yet rewarding tasks I handled was integrating Stripe for payment processing and managing user subscriptions. With guidance from my team, I was able to successfully implement this core functionality.

name: ChangeLog
shortDescription: The idea behind ChangeLog is to build a platform where startups can share their product journeys—including growth, challenges, and milestones—while connecting with potential users, clients, and investors.
description:
ChangeLog was my first project with 10X Ventures, and also my first experience working entirely remotely. The platform was created to foster a 'building-in-public' culture—giving startups a space to share updates about their products, growth, setbacks, and overall journey while engaging directly with users, clients, and potential investors.


I collaborated remotely with a U.S.-based team of full-stack developers. We used Blitz.js, a React and Node.js full-stack framework built on top of Next.js and Express.js. Styling was handled using Tailwind CSS and SCSS, and we used PostgreSQL for the database.


This was my first SaaS product built with React and Node.js, and it proved to be a foundational learning experience that significantly deepened my understanding of the full-stack development process.
